steps.title: Personalize your joke to show off your humor.
steps.content: Personalize your joke to show off your humor. When youâ€™re starting out, itâ€™s great to have a bunch of pick-up lines in your back pocket. But if you want to level up your game, reference your crushâ€™s favorite team, player, or position. This makes your line less generic, plus makes the other person feel special . When initiating a conversation on a dating app, Bilotta says to â€œavoid using generic opening lines and instead strive for a personalized approach that demonstrates your interest and sincerity.â€ Be sure to â€œuse an interesting and engaging conversation starter that shows you've taken the time to read the other person's profile.â€

steps.title: Wait for the perfect time to drop your line.
steps.content: Wait for the perfect time to drop your line. Timing is everything when it comes to delivering pick-up lines, so feel the flow of the conversation before making your move. In general, opening with a rizz joke is a great strategy to flirt with someone . But if youâ€™re already chatting, wait for a break in conversation to score big in love. If youâ€™re approaching someone in person, Jacoby says â€œbeing friendly is all it takes.â€ You donâ€™t have to be â€œsuper smooth or rehearsed all the time,â€ and having a â€œbig smile and a warm personalityâ€ can help you make a good first impression.

steps.title: Maintain eye contact and smile.

If youâ€™re flirting with someone on a dating app, Bilotta says â€œemojis can be a great way to add a playful tone to your messages and convey your sense of humor.â€ Send a ğŸ˜‰, ğŸ˜ˆ, or ğŸ˜ to lighten the mood and be extra flirty!

steps.title: Respect the other personâ€™s boundaries.
steps.content: Respect the other personâ€™s boundaries. In general, a person will appreciate a flirty joke if theyâ€™re into, but feel uncomfortable or creeped out if they donâ€™t like you. Some signs that they might be interested include: having open body language, making eye contact, trying to touch you, fidgeting around you, or giving you compliments. If youâ€™re on a date, you can tell itâ€™s going well if the person is â€œfacing you or mirroring your body language,â€ according to Jacoby. If your pick-up line falls flat, donâ€™t try to explain it. Instead, make a joke about the line! For example, you could tell them it was terrible but that they were making you nervous. Bilotta says, â€œone of the best ways to put someone at ease and build a connection is to be willing to laugh at yourself.â€
